events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application to cover medical expenses expected next month.
The loan application was categorized as a Personal Loan due to mention of medical expense coverage.
Loan officer Jessica Kim was assigned to manage the application and guide the applicant through the process.
Initial review completed with no red flags; applicant’s income and expense details verified for medical loan purpose.
Applicant was asked to submit medical bills, proof of income, and identification to proceed with the personal loan acceptance criteria.
All requested documents including medical bills and pay stubs were submitted by the applicant on time for further verification.
Credit check returned a good credit score of 720 indicating the applicant’s ability to repay the personal loan comfortably.
Risk assessment suggests low risk for lending the medical-related personal loan given stable employment and income data.
Loan officer presented a personal loan offer of $15,000 with a favorable interest rate and repayment terms.
Applicant expressed satisfaction with the loan offer and asked for clarification on payment schedule and early payoff options.
Application was escalated to senior management for approval of a lower interest rate requested by the applicant.
The personal loan application was approved with revised terms including a reduced interest rate as requested.
Loan amount of $15,000 was disbursed into the applicant’s bank account to cover the anticipated medical expenses.
Loan officer followed up with the applicant to confirm receipt of funds and satisfaction with the loan process.
The personal loan application case was formally closed after confirmation that all steps were successfully completed.
